titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Gatten Film and Ephemera, 2010-2012 RL.11100
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon; Craig Breaden

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-04-28 14:06:47 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: David Edward Gatten is an American experimental filmmaker and moving image artist. Collection consists of one film reel: Film for Invisible Ink case no. 323: ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE WEST (dated 2010; 20 minutes, black-and-white, sound, 16mm). Also includes two copies of the catalog from Gatten's 2012 travelling retrospective of his career: Ex Libris: Texts of Light, as well as an announcement for the 2012 premiere of his first digital film The Extravagant Shadows. Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: David Edward Gatten is an American experimental filmmaker and moving image artist who has won numerous awards and accolades for his avant-garde works. He is currently Professor of Film Studies in the Film Studies Program at the University of Colorado in Boulder.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access is restricted: Film should not be digitized, but can be projected for researchers.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The David Gatten Film and Ephemera were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], David Gatten Film and Ephemera, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0091

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of one film reel: Film for Invisible Ink case no. 323: ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE WEST (dated 2010; 20 minutes, black-and-white, sound, 16mm), created specifically for his wedding to fellow filmmaker Erin Espelie.

Also includes two copies of the catalog from Gatten's 2012 travelling retrospective of his career: Ex Libris: Texts of Light, as well as an announcement for the 2012 premiere of his first digital film The Extravagant Shadows.
Acquired as part of the Archive of Documentary Arts at Duke University.

did.unittitle: Film for Invisible Ink, case no. 323: ONCE UPON A TIME IN THE WEST

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Film may only be projected in a motion picture film projector. Contact Research Services for further information. Special instructions for projection from David Gatten: "PROJECTIONIST: Optical Soundtrack is the Film Base; increase volume 35% beyond 'normal' level."

did.unittitle: Catalog for Ex Libris: Texts of Light: A Mid-Career Retrospective of Fourteen Films by David Gatten
Announcement for the premiere of The Extravagant Shadows
